title: U.S. to make payments to families of Kunduz air strike victims: Pentagon
text: 9,659 U.S. to make payments to families of Kunduz air strike victims: Pentagon 'The U.S. Department of Defense will seek to make "condolence payments" to families of victims of a U.S. air strike that mistakenly hit a Medecins Sans Frontieres hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan, killing 22 people, the Pentagon said on Saturday."The Department of Defense believes it is important to address the consequences of the tragic incident at the Doctors Without Borders hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan," spokesman Peter Cook said in a statement, adding the United States would also pay to repair the charity hospital."U.S. Forces-Afghanistan has the authority to make condolence payments and payments toward repair of the hospital. USFOR-A will work with those affected to determine appropriate payments. If necessary and appropriate, the administration will seek additional authority from the Congress," he said.' 9,659 Re: U.S. to make payments to families of Kunduz air strike victims: Pentagon My thoughts are what a ridiculous notion. Either you give money to all your innocent victims or you give it to none. What makes these innocent victims worthy of payouts but not the hundreds/thousands of other innocent 'collateral damage' victims? Simple....these victims are international doctors with a ton more clout then the nameless innocents killed before. Last edited by DA60; Today at 12:05 AM . All that I feel is the realness I'm faking.
